<title level="1" pfs="Standard">[Theletos](/Monsters.aspx?ID=536)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

Theletoses maintain the balance between fate and free will. A theletos is a roughly spherical mass of crystals from which emerge four limbs, each split at the elbow and ending in three-fingered hands. A pair of crystalline tentacles also emerges from its body. Those who have been damaged by a theletos's tentacles describe a disorienting dilemma as they simultaneously feel forced to make a single choice while also being overwhelmed by the endless options available to choose from. Theletoses are more likely than most aeons to interfere in non-aeon societies, particularly in regions with draconian laws. Their involvement is twofold; a theletos concerns itself with both the freedom of individuals and the laws that restrict these individuals, even (or especially) when the two are in opposition.

([Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13)): DC 23

**[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 21

</column>

</column>

<image src="/images/Monsters/Aeon_Theletos.png" />
</column>

</row>

<title level="2" right="Creature 7">[Theletos](/Monsters.aspx?ID=536)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="LN" url="/Rules.aspx?ID=95" />
<trait label="Medium" />
<trait label="Aeon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=208" />
<trait label="Monitor" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=111" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Bestiary 2](/Sources.aspx?ID=32) pg. 8 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

**Perception** +18; darkvision

**Languages**
envisioning

**Skills**
[Arcana](/Skills.aspx?ID=2) +16, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +16, [Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13) +18, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +15

<row gap="medium">
**Str** +4

**Dex** +4

**Con** +3

**Int** +3

**Wis** +5

**Cha** +3
</row>

**Envisioning** When a theletos conveys information, it does so wordlessly through psychic projections. This acts as [telepathy](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=37) with a range of 100 feet but is understandable to all creatures regardless of whether they have a language. The meaning to non-aeons can be vague and is often mysterious. A theletos can use this ability to communicate flawlessly with any other aeon on the same plane.

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 25 

**Fort** +16 

**Ref** +13 

**Will** +18 

+1 status to all saves vs. magic
</row>

**HP** 125

**Weaknesses**
chaotic 5

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 25 feet, fly 25 feet

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
fist +17 ([Lawful](/Traits.aspx?ID=99), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103)),
**Damage** 2d10+4 bludgeoning plus 1d6 lawful

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
tentacle +17 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Lawful](/Traits.aspx?ID=99), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103)),
**Damage** 2d8+4 slashing plus 1d6 lawful and fate drain

**Divine Innate Spells** DC 25, attack +17
- **4th**
[Augury](/Spells.aspx?ID=15) (at will), [Charm](/Spells.aspx?ID=34), [Dispel Magic](/Spells.aspx?ID=78), [Enthrall](/Spells.aspx?ID=104), [Outcast's Curse](/Spells.aspx?ID=211), [Remove Curse](/Spells.aspx?ID=250), [Suggestion](/Spells.aspx?ID=315), [Touch of Idiocy](/Spells.aspx?ID=341)

**Rituals** DC 25

- **3rd**
[Geas](/Rituals.aspx?ID=12)

**Fate Drain**  ([Curse](/Traits.aspx?ID=38), [Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [Mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106)) A creature damaged by the theletos's tentacle must succeed at a DC 22 Will save or become [stupefied 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=37). As long as the creature is stupefied, it can no longer benefit from [fortune](/Traits.aspx?ID=76) effects. If the target fails additional saves against this ability, the condition value increases by 1 (to a maximum of stupefied 4). This condition value decreases by 1 every 24 hours.

**Wrath of Fate** <actions string="Two Actions" /> ([Curse](/Traits.aspx?ID=38), [Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [Mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106), [Misfortune](/Traits.aspx?ID=110)) The theletos releases a 60-foot cone of energy from its center. Creatures in the cone become overwhelmed with the knowledge of various fates that destiny has in store for them and lack of clear pathways to these potential futures. They must succeed at a DC 26 Will save or be [slowed 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=35) indefinitely. An affected creature can choose to roll twice when it attempts an attack, saving throw, or skill check and take the lower result. Regardless of the outcome, that creature is no longer slowed after that roll. The theletos can't use Wrath of Fate again for 1d4 rounds.

</column>

<aside>
<title level="2" noclass="true" icon="/images/Icons/Sidebar_2_AdditionalLore.png">Maintaining the Balance</title>

Theletoses care little for the individuals and societies they manipulate, only that balance between freedom and fate is maintained. A theletos might help a creature who has lost their freedom escape, but it may also force those who swore to perform an unjust duty to stick to their word. If its plans are thwarted, a theletos doesn't seek revenge, but instead looks for other ways to redress the balance.
</aside>
